Legal_Issue: Did the Electoral Supervisor exceed jurisdiction by disqualifying the applicant post-nomination meeting?
Application_Facts: The applicant claimed residency but complaints arose. Supervisor removed her name citing non-compliance with residency rules.
Decision_Outcome: Supervisor did not exceed jurisdiction; application for judicial review dismissed.
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Supervisor's decision
Defendant_Behavior: Electoral Supervisor disqualified the applicant post-nomination based on alleged residency non-compliance
Legal_Standard: Strict construction vs. purpose-based interpretation of Election Law
Assessment_Factor: Residency compliance and credibility of applicant's claim
Review_Standard: Interpretation of statutory provisions governing candidacy and eligibility
Evidence_Used: Proof of eligibility documentation and complaints regarding residency
Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections 3(c), 16, 24, 71, 74, 75, and 91 of Samson Election Law
Application_Basis: Non-compliance with residency requirements for candidacy
Relief_Sought: Reinstatement of candidacy and reversal of disqualification
Governing_Rule: Samson Election Law provisions on candidacy, eligibility, and appeals
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient or disputed proof of residency
Harm_Assessment: Removal from candidate list affecting electoral participation
Cause_Description: Applicant's alleged false residency claim led to removal from candidate list
Evidence_Handling: Court evaluated evidence of residency under election law standards
Legal_Provision_Violated: Residency requirements under Samson Election Law
Jurisdictional_Issue: Whether Supervisor had authority to disqualify post-nomination meeting
Evidence_Assessment: Weighed strict vs. purposive interpretation of law in evaluating evidence
Decision_Rationale: Supervisor acted within jurisdiction; legal provisions supported disqualification for non-compliance
Evidentiary_Issues: Credibility and sufficiency of residency evidence
Legal_Standard_Applied: Statutory interpretation and jurisdictional limits under election law
